metadata.synopsis: Dialog with the ghost of Kerri Evenfield, now freed from Oskar's body and hells-bent on taking him to the afterlife with her. She's incandescent with angry, but if the player successfully calms her anger, they can hear her explanation of her recent suicide, and get her to leave peacefully. Otherwise, they end up in combat.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Enter the trigger S_LOW_FinalConfrontationTrigger in CTY_Main_A after having destroyed kerri's portrait in the atelier with the candle of revocation.Location:CTY_Main_A  -250; 30; -46

50.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
50.text: Who are you? Get out. GET OUT!
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kerri has cornered a very frightened-looking Oskar. Oskar holds up his hands in a placatory/calming gesture. Kerri turns to her left 80 degrees and sees the player, face twisted with fury.NodeContext: Furious, threatening

26.speaker: Oskar Fevras
26.text: Please... Kerri, my darling, listen to me -
26.context: NodeContext: Frightened, hoping his charm will calm her down

69.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
69.text: You brought me here. YOU DID THIS.

22.speaker: Lady Jannath
22.text: Do something - she's going to kill him!

51.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
51.text: DO NOT INTERFERE. He's coming home with me.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kerri turns to her left 90 degrees from Oskar, and squares up to the player on DO NOT INTERFERE. She blocks their access to Oskar.NodeContext: Haunting, threatening

70.text: Calm yourself, shade. We can resolve this peacefully.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Calm yourself, shade. We can resolve this peacefully.

71.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
71.text: Another who wants to control me.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: To the realms of the dead? You'll kill him!

85.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
85.text: He called me here. Trapped me. Pathetic little childish boy.

46.speaker: Oskar Fevras
46.text: I only wished to explain myself. To make you see how -
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raises a hand, as though uncertain about drawing attention to himselfNodeContext: trying to say "how sorry I was", but gets cut off

30.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
30.text: NO! Enough of your whining. ENOUGH.
30.context: NodeContext: Furious, taking control of the situation

35.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
35.text: Selfish, arrogant bastard of an artist. I wanted to be left in peace.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oskar cowers as Kerri turns to her right 80 degrees towards him. The player edges closer.NodeContext: Fury starting to break, a hint of sadness beneath it all

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Please. Tell us what happened to you.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stifling a sobNodeContext: Stifling a sob

60.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
60.text: And how does that help me? Or is it just to help him?

76.speaker: Player
76.text: You don't seem all that peaceful to me.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stifling a sobNodeContext: Stifling a sob

33.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
33.text: Neither would you, if you'd been dragged here by this self-important arsehole.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stifling a sobNodeContext: Stifling a sob

2.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
2.text: Why does everything always have to revolve around Oskar Fevras?
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stifling a sobNodeContext: Stifling a sob

75.speaker: Oskar Fevras
75.text: Oh, my sweet Kerri. What did I do to you?
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stifling a sobNodeContext: Stifling a sob

58.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
58.text: Save your tears for the Ethereal Plane...
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kerri takes a big step towards Oskar, who shields his face, expecting an attack.NodeContext: Menacing, about to kill him

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Touch him, and you'll face all of nature's fury. You'll face me.

55.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
55.text: What are you saying? You're trying to confuse me.

12.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
12.text: What are you saying? You're trying to confuse me.

57.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
57.text: It's so hard to think. I don't remember.
57.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with herself, still angry

63.speaker: Oskar Fevras
63.text: Kerri, my sweet meat. I just need to know that what you did... that it wasn't my fault -

49.speaker: Lady Jannath
49.context: NodeContext: Low, strict - trying not to attrack Kerri's attention

89.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
89.text: Why am I here? I shouldn't be here, I shouldn't be.
89.context: NodeContext: Angry, distressed. Unclear whether she's about to lash out, or break down in tears. Almost accusing the player.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *The spirit's aura flickers, changes. She is confused, lost - dragged here unwillingly by a man who refused to let her leave.*

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You had a message for us, remember? You were going to tell us why you died by your own hand.

17.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
17.text: You're a worthless human and a worse artist, Oskar Fevras. You never should have brought me here.

34.text: Fine. If Oskar wants the truth, he can have it: we were a fling, nothing more.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing a finger at Oskar

40.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
40.text: Fine. If Oskar wants the truth, he can have it: we were a fling, nothing more.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing a finger at Oskar

13.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
13.text: My decision had nothing to do with him. I did this because I was so fucking sad. All the time.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing a finger at Oskar

67.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
67.text: Oskar finds it easier to imagine a world where women kill themselves over him than one where they have their own bloody problems.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing a finger at Oskar

64.speaker: Oskar Fevras
64.text: I'm sorry, Kerri. I had no idea. But I - I was truly not to blame?
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Almost sagging with reliefNodeContext: Contrite, humbled

68.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
68.text: No, you weren't, so you and your poxy paintings stay away from me. We're done, Oskar. Over. Now let me rest in bloody peace.
68.context: NodeContext: Pissed off but back in control of herself. A stern warning at the end.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You came to deliver a message. To tell us what led to your fate.
72.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Tell Oskar what he wants to hear. OUT WITH IT.
23.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

62.speaker: Player
62.text: You owe Oskar an explanation. And you're going to give it to him...
62.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Do not be shackled by your story, spirit. Share it - let it set you free.
59.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Oskar does not matter - you do. Say what you need to say to him - no matter how difficult it is.
65.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

44.speaker: Player
44.text: No more harm will come to you by sharing your story. But it could help Oskar.
44.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Calm, spirit. Tell us of your fate, then your soul shall be freed - I swear it.
73.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

79.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
79.text: Why should I trust you? Why would I ever trust him?
79.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

81.text: Why should I trust you? Why would I ever trust him?
81.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

4.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
4.text: Why should I trust you? Why would I ever trust him?
4.context: NodeContext: getting increasingly flustered and angry

45.speaker: Player
45.text: You owe Oskar nothing. He only brought you here to soothe his conscience.

8.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
8.text: If you believe that, then why are you helping him?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Your bonds are broken. Go, if that is your wish.

61.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
61.text: And let Oskar walk away? No, I won't do it.

87.text: And who are you, some fawning obsessive like that rich cow 'Lady Jannath'? I bet Oskar loves that.
87.context: NodeContext: 'Lady Jannath' in a mocking way

7.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
7.text: And who are you, some fawning obsessive like that rich cow 'Lady Jannath'? I bet Oskar loves that.
7.context: NodeContext: 'Lady Jannath' in a mocking way

28.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
28.text: Die with him if you love him so much.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: You're on the Material Plane - my hunting ground. Back off, or face me.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I'll burn you, and potentially everyone else here, to ash if you don't stop this.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You will burn like everything else on this plane, spirit, if you harm this man.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Stop this, or I will educate you on the true meaning of torment and suffering.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I don't care if you're a spirit. Touch him, and I'll break you.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: The Kerri Oskar spoke of was kind and gentle. This isn't the real you.

56.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
56.text: Why should I be the better person? He's the one tormenting me!

6.text: Why should I be the better person? He's the one tormenting me!

31.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
31.text: Why should I be the better person? He's the one tormenting me!

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Your spirit is twisted by hate and fear, but this isn't you. You're kind and gentle - I can sense it.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Ask yourself  - will killing this man make you happy? Give you purpose? Or are you better than this?

9.speaker: Player
9.text: He won't disturb you again. I'll make sure of it.

10.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
10.text: And you think he'll listen to you? He doesn't listen to anyone.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Mystic Carrion was the one behind this. It wasn't Oskar's fault.

11.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
11.text: I'm here because Oskar wanted me here. To make him feel better.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I rather like interfering. It's kind of my thing.

25.speaker: Kerri Evenfield
25.text: Then you're as bad as him.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Listen - you're lost and in pain. This plane is not meant for spirits.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I don't take orders from most people - especially not a ghost. Stand down.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Hurt this man, and you will face the consequences, spirit.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: This man is under my protection - I cannot let you hurt him.
